recipes.title: Classic Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C) with a pizza stone or baking sheet inside.
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to about 12 inches in diameter.
Crush the San Marzano tomatoes by hand and spread evenly over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border.
Tear the mozzarella into small pieces and distribute over the sauce.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt.
Transfer to the hot pizza stone and bake for 12-15 minutes until crust is golden.
Remove from oven and immediately top with fresh basil leaves.
Let cool for 2-3 minutes before slicing and serving.
recipes.notes: Best pizza dough recipe from my Italian grandmother. The key is using San Marzano tomatoes!

recipes.title: Creamy Chicken Alfredo
instructions: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup pasta water.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then cook in a large skillet until golden brown and cooked through, about 6-7 minutes per side.
Remove chicken and let rest, then slice into strips.
In the same skillet, melt butter and sauté minced garlic for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a gentle simmer.
Gradually whisk in grated Parmesan cheese until smooth and creamy.
Add cooked pasta and chicken back to the skillet, tossing to coat.
Add pasta water as needed to achieve desired consistency.
Season with additional salt, pepper, and serve immediately with extra Parmesan.
recipes.notes: Viral TikTok recipe! Make sure not to boil the cream or it will curdle.

recipes.title: Thai Green Curry
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons of thick coconut cream in a wok or large pan over medium heat.
Add green curry paste and fry for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Add sliced chicken and cook until just done, about 5 minutes.
Pour in remaining coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add quartered Thai eggplant and green beans, cook for 5 minutes.
Season with fish sauce, palm sugar, and lime juice to taste.
Add Thai basil leaves and stir gently.
Serve immediately with jasmine rice.
recipes.notes: Authentic recipe from a Thai cooking channel. Adjust spice level by using more or less curry paste.

recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter and both sugars until fluffy, about 3 minutes.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually mix dry ingredients into wet ingredients until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets, spacing 2 inches apart.
Bake for 9-11 minutes until golden brown around edges.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to wire rack.
recipes.notes: The secret is to slightly underbake them for chewy centers! Popular Pinterest recipe with 50K saves.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
instructions: Rinse quinoa under cold water until water runs clear.
Cook quinoa in 2 cups of salted water, bring to boil, then simmer covered for 15 minutes.
Let quinoa cool completely after cooking.
Halve cherry tomatoes, dice cucumber, and finely chop red onion.
Crumble feta cheese and roughly chop parsley.
In a large bowl, combine cooled quinoa with all vegetables.
Whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, and oregano for dressing.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently to combine.
Add feta cheese and parsley, toss once more.
Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
recipes.notes: Perfect for meal prep! Stays fresh in fridge for up to 3 days. Great for summer picnics.
